main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed flying erratically towards the west at high speeds in Corpus Christi, Texas in 1955. The objects were saucer-shaped, changing from blue to purple and back again, and estimated to be at an altitude of approximately 50,000 feet. The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as two small saucer-shaped beads that changed colors from blue to purple.
The UFOs were observed flying erratically at high speeds towards the west, with no sound and occasionally hovering before resuming their rapid flight.
The witnesses, including individuals employed at the local Naval Air Station, reported consistent observations of the objects' behavior and appearance.
The sighting was reported to the USAF unit located at Corpus Christi and was investigated by personnel from Project Blue Book.
The report was signed by Charles N. Hilton from Corpus Christi, Texas, on November 18, 1955.
witnesses: individuals employed at the local Naval Air Station
